thread.title: Police Are Asking For Help In Finding A Little Girl
thread.title_full: Police Are Asking For Help In Finding A Little Girl

author: Bernadette Lee
title: Police Are Asking For Help In Finding A Little Girl
text:
Share on Twitter 
The Louisiana State Police has issued a Level II Endangered/Missing Child Advisory to help out the Harris County Sheriff’s Office in Texas as they are trying to find a missing 6-year-old girl. 
They say she was taken by Harvey Eugene York Jr. of Zwolle, Louisiana. They think York is heading to Louisiana. Alexis Johnson, photo courtesy of TX AMBER Alert 
The little girl Alexis Johnson, know as Lexi, is a white female with brown eyes and har. She is 3 feet, seven inches tall, and she weighs about 63 pounds. She has long hair, and the little girl wears glasses. 
Police say Harvey York is a white man with brown hair and green eyes who stand about 5 feet, seven inches tall. York weighs about 160 pounds. 
York and the little girl were last seen yesterday in Houston, Texas. 
Harvey York, photo courtesy of State Police 
York was seen driving an F-150 Ford truck. His license plate is F163202. The truck is blue in color, and it has a silver stripe. 
Anyone with information on the little girl Lexi or York is urged to call 911, Louisiana State Police or the Harris County Sheriff’s Office at 713-221-6000. 
York is not the little girl’s father.
